intro: Didiscus glandulosus var. leiocarpus, commonly known as the smooth-capsule didiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are typically smooth and green when mature. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
